intro: Chabraea viscida, commonly known as the sticky chabraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and sticky secretions on its stems and leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
